page.title: 20Life Styles: Farmer/Vicar
page.content: Most of the land around Cholsey and South Moreton is farmland but farming does not employ many people, as one farm worker can operate many different types of machinery. Most of the land is used for growing crops so machines for {ploughing, sowing, spraying and harvesting} are needed. The farm worker spends long hours in the open air, in all weathers is and not very well paid. The Vicar is in charge of the church and is much in demand for Christenings, weddings and funerals. He also has to try and get the community working together and is involved in all kinds of committees and organisations. People from all walks of life will turn to him in times of trouble for advice, comfort and an understanding ear. Each Sunday he has to lead two or three church services and at all times must attend to the needs of his parishioners.
